channel.title: Undisclosed
channel.description: The Undisclosed podcast investigates wrongful convictions, and the U.S. criminal justice system, by taking a closer look at the perpetration of a crime, its investigation, the trial, and ultimate verdict... and finding new evidence that never made it to court.
channel.itunes:summary: The Undisclosed podcast investigates wrongful convictions, and the U.S. criminal justice system, by taking a closer look at the perpetration of a crime, its investigation, the trial, and ultimate verdict... and finding new evidence that never made it to court.
channel.itunes:author: Undisclosed

item.title: Rabia and Ellyn Solve the Case is Available Now!
item.description:
Rabia Chaudry and Ellyn Marsh, both well known names in true crime podcasting, will bring their separate audiences, experience, and unique talents to tell you all of the things you might not know about some of the most famous true crime cases. This bi-weekly true crime talk show will ask why celebrities are obsessed with true crime, and also will examine some of the most infamous cases they are obsessed with through the lens of Chaudry’s legal expertise and Marsh’s comedy. It's the cross-over podcast listeners have been waiting for.... can you solve the case?

Apple Podcasts:  https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/rabia-and-ellyn-solve-the-case/id1646694616

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/3ojMLLts8DyhcyrpFIrf7G?si=osASMgs2TVGvXCn0-vfOog

item.title: Episode 1 of Proof: Russian Roulette – Podcast Preview
item.description:
Here's a preview of Episode 1 of Susan's new podcast, Proof: Russian Roulette. Listen to the rest at:

https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/proof-a-true-crime-podcast/id1611647977

https://open.spotify.com/show/7cIYTvLd8QgwirW7EhCAGH

On an October night in 1996, a gunshot rattles the walls of a double-wide trailer on the outskirts of Rome, Georgia. A 15-year-old boy is killed – and two of his friends are arrested and sentenced to life in prison, where they remain today. An evil teenage plot? Or a blatant miscarriage of justice? In this first season of PROOF, Susan Simpson and Jacinda Davis drive the back roads of Rome, searching for the truth.
item.itunes:author: Undisclosed

item.title: Subscribe to Nighty Night with Rabia Chaudry
item.description: Nighty Night is a horror anthology series where famed attorney, author and podcaster Rabia Chaudry delivers bone-chilling bedtime stories that will be sure to keep you wide awake all night long. These creepy tales will be a mix of both original content and lesser known classics delivered with a modern spin. Listen on all audio platforms now!

item.title: S5 Ep16: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 9 - Peyton Place
item.itunes:title: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 9 - Peyton Place
item.description:
January 18, 2021 / The cold case team began its investigation into Jeff Titus by interviewing dozens of his former coworkers. Their strategy paid off – at Jeff Titus's trial, over a dozen of his coworkers testified to hearing him make incriminating statements. But how accurate were their memories? And was what they had to say actually evidence of murder?

Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

#undisclosed

item.title: S5 Ep15: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Addendum 8
item.itunes:title: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Addendum 8
item.description:
January 7, 2021 / Rebecca Lavoie discusses Episode 8 of Undisclosed: State v. Jeff Titus, "Little Rumors Everywhere," with Susan Simpson, and guests Anya Bidwell and John Ross of the Institute for Justice's Bound by Oath podcast. In Season 2, Bound By Oath is exploring how government officials evade accountability through qualified immunity and other legal loopholes.

You can listen to Season 2 of Bound by Oath at: https://ij.org/center-for-judicial-engagement/sc/14th-at-150-podcast/.

item.itunes:title: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 7 - Keep Out
item.description:
December 14, 2020 / The prosecution convicted Jeff Titus on the theory that his obsession with his property had driven him to commit murder. To prove this, the state introduced testimony about four different occasions that Jeff Titus had aggressively targeted hunters in the woods – but the jury never got to hear the whole story.

item.title: S5 Ep10: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 6 - The Alibi and the Devil's Advocate
item.itunes:title: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 6 - The Alibi and the Devil's Advocate
item.description:
December 7, 2020 / At Jeff Titus's trial, his alibi witness Stan Driskell testified that, on the evening of the murders at the Fulton Game Area, he and Titus had been hunting 27 miles away. But Titus's neighbor, Bonnie Huffman, testified that she'd seen Titus near the scene of the crime that evening – and that Stan hadn't been with him. 

Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

#undisclosed #freejefftitus

item.title: S5 Ep9: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 5 - On the Origin of the Doe
item.itunes:title: S5, The State v. Jeff Titus - Episode 5 - On the Origin of the Doe
item.description:
November 30, 2020 / In 1990, Jeff Titus was cleared as a suspect in the murder of two deer hunters after his alibi witnesses confirmed he'd been 27 miles away at the time the homicides occurred. But he was convicted of the crime in 2002, after the cold case team that reopened the investigation discovered what it believed to be a flaw in Jeff Titus's alibi.

Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

#undisclosed #freejefftitus

item.title: State v. Fred Freeman - Episode 1 - Chuck Norris Action Jeans
item.description:
April 6, 2020 / Frederick Freeman is accused of the 1986 murder of community college student Scott Macklem, but a bevy of alibi witnesses complicate the State's case.

Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

Checkout a new podcast called Wrongful Conviction: False Confessions.
A powerful 13-episode podcast that tells the story of twelve real false confessions using actual audiotapes from inside the interrogation room and diving deep into the disturbing psychological techniques used to extract confessions from innocent suspects. Wrongful Conviction: False Confessions is available on the Wrongful Conviction Podcast feed, wherever you get you podcasts.

item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. - Update Episode
item.description:
August 26, 2019 / On August 5, Keith Davis Jr’s defense filed a motion for a new trial, requesting Judge Sylvester Cox to vacate the jury’s conviction on seven grounds, six of which argue the prosecutor committed egregious error during their closing arguments. In this update episode, host Amelia McDonell-Parry talks to Erica Suter and Zach Zwagil about the State's closing, the various legal issues, and where Keith goes from here.

Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Chris Zabriskie, Uncanny Valleys and Spencer Burdette.

item.description:
July 22, 2019 / Marilyn Mosby’s handling of the Keith Davis Jr. case was about politics too.  There was no investigation into what really happened during the police involved shooting before her office agreed to prosecute him. item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. - Episode 9 - Veney
item.description:
July 19, 2019 / A 2018 Washington Post analysis of Baltimore crime data found that between 2007-2017, 65 percent of all homicide cases during that 10 year period were unsolved, with the highest concentration in northwest Baltimore around Park Heights. The murder of Kevin Jones would very likely be one of those unsolved cases, if not for two things.  Five hours after Jones was murdered, a half-mile down the road, Keith Davis Jr. was shot in the face by Baltimore Police. And by then, Homicide Detective Mark Veney was on the case.

Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Uncanny Valley and Spencer Burdette.
 
This episode was sponsored by Native.
 
www.NativeDeodorant.com and use promo code UNDISCLOSED at checkout!

item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. - Episode 8 – Kevin Jones
item.description:
July 15, 2019 / On February 25, 2016, Keith Davis Jr. was acquitted of 15 out of 16 charges related to the morning he was shot by Baltimore Police. He was found guilty of "illegal possession of a handgun as a convicted felon," a contradictory verdict based on a technicality that some believe was misrepresented by the prosecutor. But suddenly, Keith had a new case to worry about. Five days after the verdict, Baltimore Police announced that Keith had been charged with the murder of 22-year-old Kevin Jones, who was killed five hours before the police involved shooting. The gun that was found in the garage had been "ballistically linked" to Jones's murder -- and Keith has been fighting to prove his innocence ever since. This week, he began his fourth trial for the murder of Kevin Jones -- and this episode includes a bombshell that was dropped in court on the very first day.
 
Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Uncanny Valley and Spencer Burdette.
 
This episode was sponsored by thredUP.
 
www.thredup.com/Undisclosed

May 16, 2019 / Susan chats about the fourth episode of our Keith Davis Jr. series with host Amelia McDonell-Parry, Keith's wife Kelly Davis, and Team Keith member Peggy Amacker Murphy -- who also officiated Keith and Kelly's wedding! Learn more about Keith's ongoing health issues and why it took two years for the bullet in his neck to finally be removed -- plus, a few details about Keith and Kelly's wedding vows.

Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

Today’s Addendum is sponsored by Best Fiends and Vistaprint.

Download Best Fiends for FREE on the Apple App Store or Google Play.

www.Vistaprint.com/Undisclosed

item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. – Episode 4 – Because of Her
item.description:
May 13, 2019 / It took eight months and three postponements by the State before Keith Davis Jr. finally faced his first trial. Held without bail, Keith was unable to fully participate in his own defense or publicly assert his innocence. If not for Kelly Holsey Davis, we very likely would not know Keith’s name, let alone his story. This is the story of how Kelly found her voice and has used it to fight for him.
Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Spencer Burdette, Chris Zabriskie, and Taylor Quimby.
This episode was sponsored by Stamps, ZipRecruiter, and Boll and Branch.
www.Stamps.com enter Undisclosed
www.ZipRecruiter.com/Undisclosed

item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. - Addendum 3 – Reality Check
item.description:

Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. – Episode 3 – The Devil Is In The Details
item.description:
May 6, 2019 / In addition to the attempted armed robbery of Charles Holden, Keith Davis Jr. was charged with committing several violent crimes against the police officers who shot him on June 7, 2015 -- including "discharging a firearm." But police and prosecutors knew all along that there was no evidence Keith ever fired a gun at police.
Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon, Blue Dot Sessions, Spencer Burdette, Chris Zabriskie, and Taylor Quimby.
This episode was sponsored by SimpliSafe.
www.SimpliSafe.com/Undisclosed
#undisclosed #freekeithdavisjr

item.description:
March 28, 2019 / Colin Miller discusses the first episode of our new series on the Keith Davis Jr. case with host Amelia McDonell-Parry and Kelly Davis, Keith's wife and fiercest advocate. They explain how it's even possible for Keith Davis Jr to be facing his fifth trial, and also share their thoughts on the political and personal motivations behind Marilyn Mosby's unrelenting prosecution.
Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

item.title: State v. Keith Davis, Jr. - Episode 1 - Sunday Morning
item.description:
April 22, 2019 / On June 7, 2015, Keith Davis Jr. became the first person shot by Baltimore police since the death of Freddie Gray. Keith survived -- and he’s been fighting for his freedom ever since. Not only is Keith Davis Jr a victim of the Baltimore Police Department’s brutality, but like Adnan Syed, he’s one of the many who they have wrongfully accused.
Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Chris Zabriskie, Patrick Cortez, Taylor Quimby.
This episode was sponsored by Vistaprint.
www.Vistaprint.com/Undisclosed
#undisclosed #freekeithdavisjr

item.description:

item.itunes:title: S3, The State v. Dennis Perry - Episode 15 – On the Money Side of the Highway
item.description:
November 5, 2018 / Civil asset forfeiture is a process by which the government can seize and obtain ownership over someone's property without convicting them of any crimes. It's also how the Camden County Sheriff's Office was able to convict Dennis Perry for the murder of Harold and Thelma Swain.

Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Patrick Cortes, and Chris Zabriskie.

item.description:

[Image: Crime scene photo, US-17 by Rising Daughter]

item.title: S3 Ep9: S3, The State v. Dennis Perry - Episode 6 – Looking At Me Like I'm Looking At You
item.itunes:title: S3, The State v. Dennis Perry - Episode 6 – Looking At Me Like I'm Looking At You
item.description:
August 13, 2018 / There were a dozen people at Rising Daughter Baptist Church the night the Swains were killed. Many years later, two witnesses would identify Dennis Perry as the shooter, and though one of those witnesses was not certain of her identification, the other had no doubts at all. But why was she so certain? And is there reason to question how reliable her identification really was?

Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Patrick Cortes, and Chris Zabriskie.

Thank you to SimpliSafe for sponsoring today's episode.

www.SimpliSafeUNDISCLOSED.com

item.title: S3 Ep7: S3, The State v. Dennis Perry - Episode 5 – Turnip’s Blood
item.itunes:title: S3, The State v. Dennis Perry - Episode 5 – Turnip’s Blood
item.description:
August 6, 2018 / At trial, the State would argue that in his first interview with investigators, Dennis Perry made statements indicating he knew more about the murders than an innocent person would know, and that in his last interview, he had basically confessed. But did Dennis Perry's allegedly incriminating statements show any special knowledge about the crime? And how can a statement in which a suspect denies any personal involvement or knowledge of a crime be a confession?

Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Patrick Cortes, and Chris Zabriskie.

This episode was sponsored by Boll and Branch and Quicken Loans.

item.itunes:title: S3, The State v. Dennis Perry - Episode 1 – Rising Daughter
item.description:
July 9, 2018 / On March 11, 1985, in a tiny community in Camden County, Georgia, a married couple were gunned down in the entryway of their church. Fifteen years would pass before an arrest was made. But was this a cold case that was finally solved, or a case that still remains unsolved despite the conviction that was obtained. 

Episode scoring music by Blue Dot Sessions, Patrick Cortes, and Chris Zabriskie.

This episode was sponsored by Casper and Parcast – Female Criminals.

item.title: Bonus Episode - Cyntoia Brown, 51-To-Life
item.description:
February 1, 2018 / Colin reports on the case of Cyntoia Brown, who was given a life sentence in Tennessee as a 16 year-old.
Want to help Cyntoia Brown and make a difference?
If you live in TN, please contact your state reps and let them know you want an end to 51-To-Life.
If you don't live in TN but know people who do (or people who know people that live in TN) please have them listen to this episode and contact their reps.
Contact info for members of the TN House: http://www.capitol.tn.gov/house/members/
Contact info for members of the TN Senate: http://www.capitol.tn.gov/senate/members/
Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon and Blue Dot Sessions.
#undisclosed #cyntoiabrown

item.title: State v. Terrance Lewis – Episode 3 – On the Testimony of One
item.description:
January 14, 2018 / Half a year after Bernard Howard was murdered, the police finally identified Terrance Lewis as a suspect after receiving a tip from a previously undisclosed source. At trial, though, the only evidence the prosecution used to make the case against Terrance and his co-defendants came from Star, the victim's girlfriend the first witness they spoke to.
Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon, Blue Dot Sessions.

item.title: State v. Terrance Lewis – Episode 1 – The Virtually Perfect Witness
item.description:
December 4, 2017 / One witness is all the evidence you need to obtain a conviction. And when Terrance Lewis was tried and convicted in 1999 for the murder of a man gunned down in his West Philadelphia rowhouse, one "virtually perfect" witness was all the evidence the prosecution had against him. But how perfect was her testimony, really?
Image: Satellite view of the house at 6120 Sansom, with layout reconstructed based on witness statements
Episode scoring music by Animal Weapon, Blue Dot Sessions.
THANK YOU to Casper for sponsoring this episode!
Get $50 toward any mattress purchase by visiting www.casper.com/undisclosed and using promo code UNDISCLOSED at checkout. Terms and conditions apply.

item.description:
September 11, 2017 / Gary Mitchum Reeves was paroled in 1981, a month after Bo Salmon was convicted of murder in Murray County. But that may not have been a coincidence. In making the case against Bo, the GBI learned about other murders he'd done as well.
(Photo: Evidence collected in the unsolved homicide of Jack Patton and Billy Kelly, Whitfield County Sheriff's Dept.)
Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

August 7, 2017 / After his conviction, Gary brought post-conviction challenges based on Beverly's confession to her mother's murder and his trial attorney's ineffectiveness. Although the motions were denied, the hearings provided an opportunity to hear from witnesses who had never before been questioned in the case.

Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon and Blue Dot Sessions.

item.title: State v. Gary Mitchum Reeves – Episode 3 – In Memory and Shadow
item.description:
July 24, 2017 / After Gary Reeves was sentenced to life at hard labor for the murder of his common-law wife, the State’s star witness recanted her testimony, and says instead that she never saw Gary kill her mother. But her memories and Gary's memories of who did pull the trigger seem impossible to reconcile.
(Photo: Gary Reeves while incarcerated after his conviction.)
Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon and Blue Dot Sessions,

(Photo: The house on Maple Street in Rome, Georgia, where Grace Reynolds was killed.)
Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon and Blue Dot Sessions,

item.title: S2: Bonus Episode – The Trial Tapes Litigation
item.description:
May 18, 2017 / Last year, when the Floyd County Superior Court denied Undisclosed’s request to copy the audio recording of Joey Watkins’ trial and pre-trial hearings, Caplan Cobb LLP agreed to represent Undisclosed in seeking the trial tapes, and on May 1st, the Supreme Court of Georgia heard oral arguments in Undisclosed v. State.

Special thanks go to Mike Caplan, Sarah Brewerton-Palmer, and James Cobb, our attorneys at Caplan Cobb!

Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon, Blue Dot Sessions, Chris Zabriskie, Fleslit, H-LR, Jahzzar, Remain, Uncanny Valleys, VYVCH, and Sym5.

Thank you to our sponsors! www.stamps.com use code Undisclosed www.audible.com/Undisclosed www.squarespace.com use code Undisclosed

item.title: The Killing of Freddie Gray, Episode 6 – Stops 3 & 4 – Prisoner Distress

item.title: The Killing of Freddie Gray, Episode 3 – Stop 1 – The Arrest
item.description:
March 20, 2017 / Freddie Gray was arrested for possession of an illegal switchblade knife—or so we have been told. What constitutes a legal arrest, and did Freddie’s meet the standard? What does video reveal about his arrest, and what does it conveniently leave out?
Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon, Blue Dot Sessions, Chris Zabriskie, Fleslit, H-LR, Jahzzar, Remain and Uncanny Valleys.

item.title: The Killing of Freddie Gray, Episode 1 – 80 Minutes
item.description:
March 6, 2017 / 80 minutes passed between the time Freddie Gray was loaded into a police transport van and he emerged unconscious. The Baltimore Police Department said that van carrying him took six stops during that time. But the police took a long time to release all of the information about that morning. How does their story add up?
Episode scoring music by AnimalWeapon, Blue Dot Sessions, Chris Zabriskie, Fleslit, H-LR, Jahzzar, Remain and Uncanny Valleys.
#undisclosed #freddiegray #justiceforfreddie

item.title: The Kalief Browder Story - Exclusive
item.description:
Rabia, Colin, and Susan bring you a special crossover episode where they discuss Time: The Kalief Browder Story, an upcoming docuseries about the story of Kalief Browder. The series chronicles the life of a 16 year-old student from the Bronx who spent three years on Rikers Island without ever being convicted of a crime. The Undisclosed team is joined by fellow podcasting hosts Brooke Gittings of Actual Innocence, Bob Ruff of Truth & Justice, and Payne Lindsey of Up & Vanished. To learn more about the hosts/podcasts that were a part of this collaboration episode, please visit the following websites:
Actual Innocence Podcast - www.actualinpod.com Truth & Justice Podcast - www.truthandjusticepod.com Up & Vanished Podcast - www.upandvanished.com Undisclosed Podcast - www.undisclosed-podcast.com
#KaliefBrowder

The suspect in the shooting on the Alabama Highway, though, was immediately ruled out as a suspect in Isaac’s murder. But why?

item.title: Absolutely Innocent
item.description:
May 30, 2016 / Episode scoring music by Alex Fitch, AnimalWeapon, Blue Dot Sessions, Chris Zabriskie, Julian Sartorius, and Uncanny Valleys
Rabia interviews Marty Tankleff, who at 17 was falsely convicted for the murder of his parents, and Marc Howard, a professor at Georgetown University and Marty's friend and high school classmate. To learn more about Marty's conviction and eventual exoneration, go to: http://www.martytankleff.org/
Also, stay tuned after the episode for a bonus interview with Brooke Gittings of the Actual Innocence podcast! You can listen to Actual Innocence at: https://audioboom.com/channel/actualinnocence

item.title: Cruel and Unusual
item.description:
April 25, 2016 / Rabia interviews Xavier McElrath-Bey, Youth Justice Advocate for the Campaign for the Fair Sentencing of Youth. Photo: Xavier and his public defender, Herschella Conyers.

CFSY Website: http://fairsentencingofyouth.org/

ICAN Vision/Mission and efforts as an initiative of CFSY: http://fairsentencingofyouth.org/incarcerated-childrens-advocacy-network/ http://fairsentencingofyouth.org/ican-members-work/

Xavier's personal website: http://www.thexlife.org/

ICAN members testifying in Nevada, where we were able to receive an unprecedented unanimous vote to end life without parole for children in 2015: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RMQfCjvl_Y4

JusticeAid Concert in Washington DC (May 15th). All ticket sale proceeds will go to CFSY and one of our national partners (NJDC) to support juvenile justice reform: https://justiceaid.org/

Xavier speaking before the Nevada legislature: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RMQfCjvl_Y4

Xavier at TEDxNorthwesternU 2014: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=51AqpgPCyGI

item.title: Interview with Bill Rankin of the Breakdown Podcast
item.description:
April 18, 2016 / Colin Miller interviews Bill Rankin, the reporter behind the Atlanta Journal-Constitution's podcast Breakdown. Now in its second season, Breakdown is covering the case of Justin Ross Harris, who is currently being tried for the murder of his 22 month old son.

To listen to Breakdown, go to http://breakdown.myajc.com/homepage/.
